articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to Kwak Pyong Ok, an centenarian living in Sokbong-dong, Sosong District, Pyongyang City.
					 Born into a poor peasant family before Korea's liberation, she experienced the suffering as a member of the ruined nation, being subject to maltreatment and contempt, but she has led a genuine life as a mistress of the country and land since President Kim Il Sung's liberation of Korea.
					
					 During the Fatherland Liberation War she positively struggled for the victory of the war in the rear instead of her husband killed by enemies.
					
					 The Party trained her to be a Chollima standard bearer.
					
					 She brought up her children to be service members and to work in different fields and devoted herself to the work for rendering the aid materials to the Korean People's Army after retirement.
					
					 She has balanced diet.

articles.title: Chorus and Dancing Party of Members of Women's Union Held
articles.content:
Chorus and Dancing Party of Members of Women's Union Held
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A chorus and dancing party of members of the women's union in Pyongyang were held at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium Friday to celebrate the Sixth Congress of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK).
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Su Gil and official concerned, the participants in the Sixth Congress of the DWUK, officials and members of the women's union in Pyongyang.
					
					 The performance began with narration and chorus "Joy of the People" and "Appearance of Korea". Put on the stage were such numbers as chorus "Our Country Is Witnessing Changes".
					
					 The performers expressed profound thanks to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for giving origin to the Korean women's movement, developing the women's union into the revolutionary and militant organization remaining true to the party's leadership and creating a grand garden of respect for women on this land. 
					
					 They represented the women's pride and honor of dynamically advancing along the road of victory of socialism as revolutionaries of the era under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is ushering in the greatest heyday of the Juche-oriented women's movement, true to the intention of the great leaders.
					
					 Then followed a dancing party.
					
					 The participants presented cheerful dances with the feelings of thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea which has built a socialist garden on this land by pursuing the politics of prioritizing and respecting women without an equal in the world.

articles.title: DPRK Paddler Listed as Candidate for ITTF Woman Table Tennis Star Awardee for 2016
articles.content:
DPRK Paddler Listed as Candidate for ITTF Woman Table Tennis Star Awardee for 2016
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, ITTF announced the list of men and women candidates for its table tennis star awardees for this year.
					 According to it, Kim Song I, a woman paddler of the DPRK, was nominated as a candidate.
					
					 Kim won a bronze medal at the 31st Olympic Games in August.
					
					 She bagged gold medals in the women's single of the 2012 ITTF Euro-Africa Circuit, Swedish Open and in the senior women's single and double of the 2016 ITTF World Tour Pyongyang Open.

articles.title: Korean Student Takes Special Place in Int'l Music Concours
articles.content:
Korean Student Takes Special Place in Int'l Music Concours
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Han Il Yong, a Korean student, took the special place in the 6th International Music Concours Named after Rakhmaninov held in Sankt-Peterburg, Russia from Nov. 5 to 15.
					 It was attended by over 150 ace pianists from the DPRK, Russia, China, Kazakhstan, Germany, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Estonia, U.S. and other countries.
					
					 The event took place in the first, second and third preliminaries, divided into 4 age groups.
					
					 The jury and experts admired Han for playing music works with his high artistic skill and fine musical feelings at the first group.
					
					 At the closing ceremony held on Nov. 15 he was awarded a prize of special place.

articles.title: Equipment for Producing Fishing Net Made in DPRK
articles.content:
Equipment for Producing Fishing Net Made in DPRK
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Research Institute of Mining Machinery under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has recently made equipment for producing fishing net with high tensile strength. 
					 According to Ri Sang Hyok, section chief of the institute, this equipment helps raise the quality of fishing net and its production with less manpower.

articles.title: Unha Co-op Farm of DPRK
articles.content:
Unha Co-op Farm of DPRK
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Unha Co-op Farm in Unjon County, North Phyongan Province of the DPRK, is well-known throughout the country for its successful stockbreeding.
					 The farm has produced more than 100 tons of meat and a large quantity of eggs every year, putting the monthly meat and egg supply to its peasants on a normal basis.
					
					 And it has registered good results in grain production by boosting organic fertilizer.
					
					 According to Jon Kyong Son, management board chairman of the farm, such success is attributable to the establishment of the ring-shaped rotation production system of agriculture and animal husbandry.
					
					 The farm built greenhouse-style stables based on solar heat and increased the number of livestock of good strains by introducing various feed additives. It also directed big efforts to putting the veterinary and anti-epizootic work on a scientific basis.
					
					 At present, it raises thousands of pigs, ducks, geese, rabbits and chickens while producing as many as hundreds of thousands of eggs.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Hideous Power-backed Scandal as Product of Park Geun Hye's Treacherous Politics
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Hideous Power-backed Scandal as Product of Park Geun Hye's Treacherous Politics
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The "Park Geun Hye, Choe Sun Sil scandal", the most hideous scandal in the history of south Korea, is throwing the whole society into an uncontrollable political chaos.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in an article.
					
					 The scandal did not occur by chance but it was an inevitable product of the treacherous politics unprecedented in history pursued by Park Geun Hye forsaken by the people, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the most hideous criminal case inevitable due to the unheard-of treacherous politics pursued by Park Geun Hye who has regarded the people as dogs and pigs, deceiving and mocking at them. 
					
					 Disastrous are consequences of the crimes committed by incompetent Park as she put politics and economy of south Korea and inter-Korean relations into catastrophe by dancing to the tune of a fortune-teller and witch obsessed with swindle and money-making in utter disregard of the people.
					
					 Park Geun Hye and the "Saenuri Party" are chiefly to blame for the hideous power-backed scandal and the overall crisis caused by it.
					
					 The scandal is not Choe Sun Sil's "individual breach of the constitution" but the crime committed by Park as a main player and the "Saenuri Party" is an accomplice.
					
					 It is quite natural that the south Korean people's resentment and anger at Park sparked off an all-people action with the scandal as a momentum. 
					
					 Those who are hell-bent on acts of treachery, fascism and dictatorship going against the public mind-set cannot but face a miserable end.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms S. Korean Puppet Prosecution's Investigation into Scandal Hypocritical
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms S. Korean Puppet Prosecution's Investigation into Scandal Hypocritical
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet prosecution's investigation into "Park Geun Hye, Choe Sun Sil scandal" is nothing but a third-rate burlesque deliberately orchestrated by its authorities in advance in a bid to acquit the criminals of all charges, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It was gentries of the puppet prosecution that provided the group of Choe Sun Sil with a chance to destroy the evidence proving her crimes by delaying the start of investigation into the scandal.
					
					 It was again those prosecutors that shocked the south Korean people from all walks of life by conducting investigation" into U Pyong U, one of the chief criminals, the way they "investigate the emperor".
					
					 What attitude such fools will take towards the "investigation" into traitor Park Geun Hye is crystal clear.
					
					 The puppet prosecution leaves no means untried to prevent the thorough investigation into Park through blitz tactics.
					
					 Due to the scandal the south Korean society has turned into a boiling kettle and the resentment of the people from all walks of life is mounting.
					
					 However, the prosecution is persisting in the investigation aimed to hide and play down the truth behind the scandal in order to give Park breathing spell in utter disregard of this reality. It is an intolerable mockery and challenge to the mindset of the people.
					
					 The prosecution authorities would be well advised to properly understand that shielding Park who is more dead than alive is as foolish an act as pricking their eyes with their own fingers.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan for Rushing Headlong into Revival of Militarism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Japan for Rushing Headlong into Revival of Militarism
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Kyodo News conducted opinion poll across Japan on the lapse of seven decades since the promulgation of the existing Constitution. Absolute majority of respondents strongly opposed the revision of the Constitution being pressed forward by the Abe regime. A few days later, there took place a meeting in Aomori in protest against the dispatch of the Ground "Self-Defense Force" to south Sudan. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary says that this reflected the uneasiness of Japanese and their urgent requirement.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese authorities' claim that the revision of the Constitution and the dispatch of the SDF overseas are aimed to "make a contribution to ensuring the national security and global peace" so as to cope with the complicated surrounding situation and the world situation is sheer sophism.
					
					 Such word as peace does not suit Japan.
					
					 The Japanese authorities are making serious mockery of their people by paying lip-service to "peace."
					
					 They are hiding their rash act of rushing headlong into the revival of militarism, dreaming of the era of the Empire in the past with the veil of "peace." 
					
					 Lurking behind their frequent dispatch of the SDF overseas under the pretext of the "UN peace-keeping activities" defying their people's opposition is a sinister aim to easily attain their purpose of overseas aggression by making the world familiar with it and putting it on a regular basis to blindfold the world. 
					
					 It is by no means accidental that the Japanese people are becoming increasingly vocal opposing the revision of the Constitution and the dispatch of the SDF overseas as they may to bring a horrible disaster to Japan.
					
					 The Japanese authorities had better think twice about the serious consequences to be entailed by their action, if they have reasonable thinking and are concerned about the security of the country and their people even a bit.

articles.title: Moral Corruption Is Inevitable Product of Capitalist Society: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Moral Corruption Is Inevitable Product of Capitalist Society: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Gallop opinion poll in the U.S. talked ill of the corrupt social system in the country, saying that 73 percent of the respondents held that view on moral value is getting increasingly degenerated.
					 Referring to this, Rodong Sinmun Friday says that this helps measure the Western civilization and morality bragged by the paid bourgeois trumpeters and shows what extent the moral corruption in capitalist society has reached.
					
					 The view on moral value in capitalist society including the U.S. is an outlook with individual at the center, not the popular masses, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is a common occurrence in capitalist countries with extreme individualism as moral and mental base that a husband kills his wife, children kill their parents and grandchildren kill their grandparents.
					
					 Genuine morality and ethics can not be found in capitalist society where class contradictions and conflict have reached their height.
					
					 In capitalist society bourgeois hold privileged status and exercise unchallenged rights while toiling masses fall victim to class oppression and exploitation without any right.
					
					 It is the principle of existence peculiar to capitalist world that haves exploit no-haves and the weak are swallowed up by those with the strong.  
					
					 A decadent material life, poor mental and cultured life and reactionary political life are basic features of modern capitalist society and important factor of promoting its moral corruption.
					
					 With the creation of more wealth in capitalist society, people's mental and cultural life becomes poorer, making people totally corrupt mentally and physically.
					
					 Today the moral corruption in capitalist society has gone beyond control.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Accuse Park Geun Hye of Obliterating Evidence
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Accuse Park Geun Hye of Obliterating Evidence
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye of south Korea instructed Chongwadae to obliterate evidence of Choe Sun Sil's interference in politics, according to south Korean media.
					 Two files proving this were reportedly found in a handphone of Jong Ho Song, a senior official of Chongwadae, on Oct. 29.
					
					 The files were dated October 16 and 18, which means they were created before the hot media reports that confidential documents of Chongwadae were stored in a computer of Choe.
					
					 The documents reportedly contain methods for Choe to get rid of the network of investigation by the prosecution and evade legal punishment.
					
					 Commenting on this, south Korean media accused Park and Chongwadae of trying to cover up the scandals.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Calls for Bringing down Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Calls for Bringing down Park Geun Hye
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Emergency Situation Measure Council of the south Korean Council of Christian Churches held a press conference at the building of the "National Assembly" on Tuesday, demanding the NA join in forcing Park Geun Hye to step down, according to the south Korean CBS.
					 The organization asserted that the NA should force the "president" to step down true to the will of the people, adding that Park Geun Hye has no idea of accepting the people's demand.
					
					 It proposed the NA to advance a proposal for mending the south-north relations, monitor the prosecution surveying the "Park Geun Hye, Choe Sun Sil scandal" and take a systematic measure for realizing economic democracy.

articles.title: S. Korean University Professors, Students Demand Park's Resignation
articles.content:
S. Korean University Professors, Students Demand Park's Resignation
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- According to KBS of south Korea, 262 professors of the University of Foreign Studies of south Korea issued a declaration on the situation on Nov. 15 demanding Park Geun Hye step down at once.
					 The declaration demanded Park probe the truth about the present situation and own legal and moral responsibility for it.
					
					 440 professors of Yonsei University also issued a declaration on the situation on the same day urging Park to lend an ear to the voice of the people demanding she step down of her own accord.
					
					 There took place mask rallies of students of 15 universities in Seoul demanding Park's resignation.
					
					 Candlelight rally of people from all walks of life has been going on at Chonggye plaza for the 19th consecutive days.
					
					 It was reported that the fourth candlelight rally demanding Park's resignation would take place at Kwanghwamun plaza on Nov. 19.

articles.title: S. Korean History Professors Warn Regime against "Introducing State-compiled History Textbooks"
articles.content:
S. Korean History Professors Warn Regime against "Introducing State-compiled History Textbooks"
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore said that 561 history professors of 102 universities across south Korea made public a joint statement in Seoul on Nov. 15 urging the puppet regime to halt the moves to "introduce state-compiled history textbooks".
					 To force the secondary and high schools to use the history textbooks compiled by the power of the "regime" for teaching their students is tantamount to violation of democracy, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 Unless the regime withdraws the "system of introducing the state-compiled textbooks", we will launch a campaign of rejecting the textbooks together with history teachers and citizens.

articles.title: S. Korean Social Bodies Blast Park Geun Hye's Moves to Deploy THAAD
articles.content:
S. Korean Social Bodies Blast Park Geun Hye's Moves to Deploy THAAD
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Songju Committee for Struggle against THAAD Deployment, Kimchon Citizens Measure Committee against THAAD Deployment, Songju Emergency Measure Committee for Defending Holy Land of Won Buddhism, Action for Checking THAAD Deployment and the Taegu-North Kyongsang Provincial Measure Committee against THAAD Deployment reportedly released a statement on Nov. 16 denouncing the Park Geun Hye group of traitors for trying to deploy THAAD.
					 The statement said that the regime unqualified to administer state affairs should halt the moves to deploy THAAD at once.
					
					 The statement urged Park Geun Hye to step down at once and not to put the people in danger any longer.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Blasts Puppet Defense Ministry for Its Moves for Concluding Military Agreement with Japan
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Blasts Puppet Defense Ministry for Its Moves for Concluding Military Agreement with Japan
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on Nov. 15 in an editorial said that the conclusion of the agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan may increase the concern about south Korea being involved in the U.S. missile defense system and deteriorate the security environment on the Korean peninsula 
					 It will also facilitate the revival of militarism and distortion of history by Japan.

articles.title: S. Koreans Stage Demo in Washington
articles.content:
S. Koreans Stage Demo in Washington
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean group of visitors to the U.S. for demanding the total resignation of Park Geun Hye and return of U.S. military bases staged a demonstration outside the White House in Washington on Nov. 14, according to the south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo.
					 The group informed Americans of demonstrations staged on Nov. 12 with more than one million people involved and the resentment of the south Korean people against Park Geun Hye mounting like volcano. 
					
					 Americans and foreigners passing by the White House expressed support and concern for the anti-"government" struggle in south Korea.

articles.title: Lesson Drawn from April Popular Uprising and June Popular Resistance Should Not Be Forgotten
articles.content:
Lesson Drawn from April Popular Uprising and June Popular Resistance Should Not Be Forgotten
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News carried an article written by the manager of a branch office of Jeju University of a civic organization.
					 The article referred to the fact that a people's all-out meeting took place in demand of Park Geun Hye's resignation.
					
					 It stressed that Park Chung-Hee staged May 16 coup after the April 19 Revolution and Roh Tae Woo came into office after the June Popular Resistance, adding such events should never be allowed to repeat.

articles.title: Struggle for Forcing Park Geun Hye to Step down Expands
articles.content:
Struggle for Forcing Park Geun Hye to Step down Expands
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A struggle for bringing down Park Geun Hye is reportedly expanding across south Korea.
					 A candlelight meeting took place at the Kumnam Avenue on Wednesday under the sponsorship of Kwangju Regional Headquarters of the Confederation of Trade Unions.
					
					 The Metal Workers Trade Union declared on Tuesday that it would launch a general strike in demand of Park Geun Hye's resignation.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Headquarters of the Movement for forcing Park Geun Hye to step down are being continuously formed across south Korea.
					
					 More than 300 political parties and civic and social organizations in South Kyongsang Province formed the Headquarters of the Kyongnam Movement for Forcing Park Geun Hye to Step down on Wednesday.

articles.title: Move for Concluding Agreement on Protecting Military Intelligence with Japan Rejected in S. Korea
articles.content:
Move for Concluding Agreement on Protecting Military Intelligence with Japan Rejected in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye group which is on the verge of ruin reportedly initialed an agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan in Tokyo on Monday.
					 Various circles of south Korea are in great reaction, saying that the agreement is little short of the "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty" which forced the Korean nation into colonial slavery in the past.
					
					 That day the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea in their joint statement urged the Park Geun Hye regime to immediately halt the conclusion of the agreement, the "second Ulsa Five-point Treaty", and step down.
					
					 Ri Jae Myong, mayor of Songnam City, Kyonggi Province, criticized the Park Geun Hye regime, saying it has gone completely crazy as it is running amuck in selling military intelligence to Japan.
					
					 Pak Won Sun, mayor of Seoul City, stressed that Japan is hell-bent on reviving militarism, far from making an apology and reparation for its past crimes.
					
					 The internet newspaper Minjok Ilbo in an editorial on Tuesday disclosed the wicked design of the Park Geun Hye group seeking the conclusion of the agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Accused of Gagging Media
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Accused of Gagging Media
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Traitor Park Geun Hye of south Korea was disclosed to have gagged media.
					 TV Korea of south Korea opened to public an account of the fact on Nov. 14 after getting a memo of Kim Yong Han who worked as a senior secretary for civil administration of Chongwadae from June 14, 2013 to January 9, 2014.
					
					 According to the memo, Kim Ki Chun, the then presidential chief of staff of Chongwadae, gave his juniors an instruction to "gag media" in June, 2014 when those recommended by Chongwadae as candidates for "prime minister" were marginalized under torrent of media criticism.
					
					 Jong Yun Hoe who was branded as behind-the-scene adviser to Park reportedly accused the journalists, who reported suspicion of privileges enjoyed by her daughter, of blasphemy.
					
					 Park cried out for finding out all those related to the report and "teaching them a lesson."

articles.title: Various Circles of S. Korea Reject Park Geun Hye's Refusal of Investigation by Prosecution
articles.content:
Various Circles of S. Korea Reject Park Geun Hye's Refusal of Investigation by Prosecution
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- Traitor Park Geun Hye reportedly refused an investigation by the prosecution through her lawyer.
					 Enraged by this, opposition parties and civic and social organizations of various circles are strongly protesting against her behavior.
					
					 The Minju Party warned that if Park Geun Hye breaks the promises she made in her two "apologies to the people" and refuses the investigation by the prosecution, she will meet the strong resistance of the people.
					
					 The Kukmin Party asserted that Chongwadeae is going against the sentiment of the people and Park Geun Hye should immediately step down.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Bound to Go to Hell: Organization of Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Bound to Go to Hell: Organization of Koreans in U.S.
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. in a statement on Nov. 15 said the Park Geun Hye regime is resorting to foolish war moves against the north in a deliberate bid to weather its political crisis.
					 Park, the witch "president", initialed the agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan on Nov. 14 though she is the arch criminal who committed an unprecedented monopolization of administration, the statement said, adding it is aimed to ignite a war against the north by sharing military intelligence with Japan. 
					
					 The Park regime is making great haste to conclude the agreement under the pretext of "threat from the north" in a bid to tide over its worst crisis, it charged.
					
					 Park, pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese lackey, will be judged by history and is bound to go to the hell for warmongers, it held.

articles.title: Halt to Conclusion of Agreement on Protecting Military Intelligence with Japan Demanded
articles.content:
Halt to Conclusion of Agreement on Protecting Military Intelligence with Japan Demanded
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Committee for Study of U.S. Forces Issue of the Bar Association for Democratic Society in south Korea issued a statement on Nov. 15 denouncing the authorities for initialing the agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan, according to Tongil News, a south Korean online paper.
					 Park Geun Hye has no authority to sign the treaty as she lost the trust of the people, and more intolerable is that she tries to press for military cooperation with Japan, the statement said.
					
					 The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a rally at Kwanghwamun that day opposing the THAAD deployment and the conclusion of the said agreement.
					
					 The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea held a Wednesday rally outside the Japanese Embassy in Seoul on Nov. 16 at which it demanded an immediate halt to the conclusion of the agreement.
					
					 Present there were more than ten organizations.
					
					 The organizations in a statement demanded an immediate halt to the conclusion of the agreement, the "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty" in the 21st century, urging Park Geun Hye to step down.

articles.title: Elderly Korean Residents in U.S. Demand Park Geun Hye Step down At Once
articles.content:
Elderly Korean Residents in U.S. Demand Park Geun Hye Step down At Once
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- The Society of Elderly Korean Residents in the U.S. for Independence, Democracy and Peaceful Reunification in a statement on the situation on November 15 said that Park Geun Hye step down of her own accord and if she refuses to do so, the people will oust her from office through more dynamic all-people actions, according to a south Korean online paper.
					 The patriotic figures and elderly Koreans, who have long struggled in the U.S. for the democratization and independent and peaceful reunification of the country, will fully support the all-people struggle to force Park to resign.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Sweden
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Sweden
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A Swedish committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 12.
					 Christer Lundgren, co-chairman of the European regional preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising the Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, an executive member of the Goteborg Committee, and Oskar Molleby, chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, were elected co-chairmen of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold significant political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in France
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in France
Pyongyang, November 18 (KCNA) -- A French committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 9.
					 Guy Dupre, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to broadly hold political and cultural events to praise the exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Gremiales capitalinas ofrecen funcion de coro y baile por el VI Congreso de UMDC
articles.content:
Gremiales capitalinas ofrecen funcion de coro y baile por el VI Congreso de UMDC
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En homenaje al VI Congreso de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea, tuvo lugar el dia 18 en el capitalino Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang la funcion de coro y baile de las gremiales capitalinas de esa organizacion "Iremos siempre por el camino de fidelidad bajo la direccion del Partido".
					La presenciaron Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Su Gil y los funcionarios interesados, las participantes en el VI Congreso de la UMDC, las funcionarias y miembros de esta entidad en la capital.
					
					En la funcion, iniciada por la narracion y coro "Jubilo del pueblo" y "La imagen de Corea", se presentaron el coro "Himno a la mujer de la epoca del Songun", el trio y coro "Mundo de benevolencia" y otras piezas.
					
					Las ejecutantes expresaron el sentimiento de agradecimiento al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il quienes dieron inicio al movimiento femenino de Corea, convirtieron la Union de Mujeres en la organizacion revolucionaria y combativa que apoya fielmente la direccion del Partido y establecieron en la sociedad el clima de respetar a las mujeres.
					
					Describieron en sus canciones el orgullo y dignidad de las mujeres que avanzan con pasos firmes hacia la victoria del socialismo como revolucionarias de la epoca bajo la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien abre la era de esplendor del autoctono movimiento femenino en acato al proposito de los Lideres antecesores.
					
					A continuacion, comenzo el baile.
					
					Los participantes bailaron expresando testimonios de gratitud al Partido del Trabajo de Corea que preparo un paraiso socialista en esta tierra practicando la politica de apreciar y respetar a la poblacion femenina.

articles.title: Seleccionada Kim Song I como candidata a premiado de mejor tenista de mesa 2016
articles.content:
Seleccionada Kim Song I como candidata a premiado de mejor tenista de mesa 2016
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, la Federacion Internacional de Tenis de Mesa (ITTF) dio a conocer la candidatura al premiado de mejor tenista de mesa de ambos sexos de este ano. 
					Segun la publicacion, la jugadora coreana Kim Song I fue seleccionada como candidata al premiado de mejor tenista de mesa de ITTF de 2016.
					
					En contra de pronostico de los especialistas, ella logro la medalla de bronce en el juego individual de tenis de mesa de 31o Juegos Olimpicos que tuvieron lugar en agosto pasado. Entonces, los medios de prensa evaluaron altamente la mana deportiva de ella, transmitiendo que ante su tactica se arrodillaron las jugadoras japonesas.
					
					Ella se destaco en la competencia simple de la competencia abierta de ping pong de Suecia en el marco del Giro Europa-Africa de la ITTF de 2012 y en la simple y doble de categoria de adultos de la competencia abierta de ping pong de Pyongyang en el marco del Giro Mundial de la ITTF de 2016.

articles.title: Pianista coreana ocupa lugar especial en concurso internacional de musica
articles.content:
Pianista coreana ocupa lugar especial en concurso internacional de musica
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La alumna coreana Han Il Yong ocupo el lugar especial en el 6o concurso internacional de musica Rajmaninov, efectuado desde el dia 5 hasta el 15 en San Petersburgo de Rusia.
					En el certamen participaron mas de 150 pianistas sobresalientes procedentes de la RPDC, Rusia, China, Kazajstan, Alemania, Bulgaria, Ucrania, Estonia, Estados Unidos y otros paises.
					
					El concurso se realizo en 3 rondas dividido en 4 categorias por edades.
					
					Han, perteneciente a la primera categoria, causo la admiracion del jurado y los especialistas al interpretar perfectamente las piezas musicales.
					
					En la ceremonia de clausura del dia 15, el premio de lugar especial fue otorgado a la pianista coreana.

articles.title: No cesa en Sur de Corea la lucha contra el "poder" de Park Geun-hye
articles.content:
No cesa en Sur de Corea la lucha contra el "poder" de Park Geun-hye
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Segun trascendidos, se extiende por todas las partes surcoreanas la lucha anti-Park Geun-hye.
					Bajo auspicios de la direccion regional de Kwangju de la Confederacion de Sindicatos Surcoreanos (CSS), tuvo lugar el dia 16 en la avenida Kumnam de Kwangju el mitin con velas encendidas de obreros y civiles por la dimision de Park.
					
					Por otra parte, el Sindicato Nacional de Trabajadores de la Metalurgia declaro que entraria en la huelga general para exigir la retirada del "poder" de Park.
					
					El comite ejecutivo central decidio que emprendera el paro general en el caso de que no se retire el "poder" de Park.
					
					Por otra parte, siguen organizandose en todas las localidades surcoreanas las direcciones de movimiento por la dimision de Park. 
					
					Desde cuando se organizara la accion emergente pannacional por la dimision del "poder" de Park compuesta por mas de mil 550 entidades civiles y sociales, quedaron constituidas en 16 regiones surcoreanas muchas unidades, que desarrollan la lucha anti-Park.
					
					82 entidades de la region de Taejon organizaron el dia 15 en la direccion de CSS en Taejon la direccion del movimiento de Taejon por la dimision de Park Geun-hye.
					
					En la rueda de prensa sostenida en la ocasion, los oradores insistieron en la retirada inmediata del "poder" de Park y la recuperacion del poder popular. 
					
					La declaracion leida aclaro que el unico remedio para corregir la confusion politica es la retirada incondicional e inmediata de Park.
					
					La entidad naciente determino desplegar diariamente el mitin con velas encendidas y efectuar el dia 19 un acto multitudinario sobre la situacion politica con la participacion de decenas de miles. 
					
					Mas de 300 partidos politicos y entidades civiles de la region de la provincia de Kyongsang del Sur organizaron el dia 16 la direccion del movimiento de Kyongsang del Sur por la resignacion de Park.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta resultado de la reciente encuesta de Kyodo
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta resultado de la reciente encuesta de Kyodo
Pyongyang, 18 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, la agencia noticiera japonesa Kyodo realizo una encuesta en escala nacional con motivo del septuagesimo aniversario de la promulgacion de la Constitucion vigente. Segun su resultado, la mayoria de los encuestados rechazaron fuertemente la enmienda de la Constitucion que impulsa el gobierno de Abe. Pocos dias despues, en Aomori tuvo lugar un mitin de protesta al envio de las "Fuerzas Terrestres de Autodefensa" al Sudan del Sur.
					Esos hechos reflejan el inestable estado psiquico de la poblacion japonesa.
					
					Asi insiste el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 18 y continua:
					
					Son sofismas los dichos de las autoridades japonesas de que la enmienda de la Constitucion y el despacho a ultramar de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" son para "contribuir a la seguridad nacional y la paz mundial" frente a las complicadas circunstancias del contorno y la situacion mundial.
					
					Suena mal la palabra "paz" si la pronuncia Japon.
					
					Las autoridades japonesas estan burlandose gravemente de su pueblo usando esa palabra con que disimulan sus acciones para resucitar el militarismo de la epoca imperial del pasado.
					
					A pesar del rechazo de los habitantes, ellas despachan a menudo a ultramar las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" bajo el rotulo de "actividades de mantenimiento de la paz de la ONU". Esto parte del objetivo de hacer al mundo acostumbrarse a ello y alcanzar facilmente a la larga su meta de agredir a ultramar.
					
					No es casual que se escucharan de continuo en Japon las voces en contra de la enmienda de la Constitucion y el envio a ultramar de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa".
					
					Si las autoridades japonesas tienen el juicio y piensan un poco siquiera en la seguridad del pais y el pueblo, deberan reflexionar serenamente de las consecuencias de sus acciones.
